Hi - 

I'm seeking some comments on an interesting old tsuba in my collection. It is iron sukashi work of a very unusual (undescribable, to me) shape and design. It measures 70mm x 58mm x 6mm and has remnants of black lacquer remaining on it. The hitsu-ana pillows are interesting in that hey are double-layered, the inside inlay being shakudo with a silver  overlaid plate. The tsuba has not been cut down so this is its original shape, in my opinion. Obviously it has been refitted many times. A photo is posted in nihontostudy pictures under Ron STL.  (posted under two groups...so one should work for you.)

http://tinyurl.com/2vyzfc

http://tinyurl.com/2z2u8j

Any and all comments welcomed.

Ron
STL
